qas.question: Which church did Burke most defend?
What did Burke think was the foundation of society?
Burke thought religion was beneficial to what besides souls?
What did Burke believe was the foundation of religion?
Which of Burke's parents was an athiest?
Which of Burke's parents was a deist?
What did Burke believe made political arrangements difficult?
Burke failed to show concern for what sect of Christianity?

context: Burke's religious writing comprises published works and commentary on the subject of religion. Burke's religious thought was grounded in the belief that <a1_0>religion<a1_0/> is the foundation of <b5_0>civil society<b5_0/>. He sharply criticised deism and atheism, and emphasised Christianity as a vehicle of social progress. Born in Ireland to a <a2_0>Catholic<a2_0/> <b6_0>mother<b6_0/> and a <a3_0>Protestant<a3_0/> <b7_0>father<b7_0/>, Burke vigorously defended the <a0_0>Anglican<a0_0/> Church, but also demonstrated sensitivity to <b9_0>Catholic<b9_0/> concerns. He linked the conservation of a state (established) religion with the preservation of citizens' constitutional liberties and highlighted <b8_0>Christianity<b8_0/>'s benefit not only to the believer's soul, but also to <a4_0>political arrangements<a4_0/>.
